title: Citi Awarded Best Bank in Asia by FinanceAsia Magazine
summary: Citi is the best bank in Asia for 2012 according to leading industry publication FinanceAsia. The decision was made by the editorial team at FinanceAsia magazine and was based on the performance of banks across institutional and retail banking for the last 12 months.
tag-1: Citi Awarded Best Bank in Asia by FinanceAsia Magazine
tag-2: Citi is the best bank in Asia for 2012 according to leading industry publication FinanceAsia. The decision was made by the editorial team at FinanceAsia magazine and was based on the performance of banks across institutional and retail banking for the last 12 months.
tag-3: Citi also picked up best General Industries bank. The bank's client work was also recognized with deal of the year, best mid cap equity deal, best mergers & acquisitions deal, best investment grade bond and best high yield bond. The bank also led transactions that picked up best deals in China, Hong Kong, India, South Korea, Sri Lanka and most innovative deal and best IPO in Australia.
tag-4: In the editorial write up announcing the awards, the editors said: "Citi had a remarkably good year in investment banking…its commercial bank had a good year…and Citi edged ahead in the race in China this year when it became the first global bank to issue sole-branded credit cards."
tag-5: The editorial also highlighted Citi's "continued expansion in cash management and trade" and the bank being the first to pass the 1 million mark for active mobile banking customers in Asia.
tag-6: "In a highly competitive market this independent recognition is very welcome for the whole team. I would also like to thank our clients who place their trust in Citi for some of their most important transactions," said Stephen Bird, CEO for Citi in Asia Pacific.
tag-7: In 2012, Citi Asia was the largest region by revenue and net income for Citi globally outside of North America with deposits in the region up nearly 7 percent to US$250 billion. Citi is also the leading wealth manager in Asia Pacific with more than US$200 billion assets under management.
tag-8: Citi was the only bank ranked top-three-or-better across underwriting stock, bonds and advising on M&A in the last 12 months, according to data provider Dealogic.
tag-9: In 2012, Citi raised US$150 billion from the capital markets for Asia Pacific clients and advised on nearly US$100 billion of mergers and acquisitions in the region. In retail banking Citi added more than 500,000 new retail accounts to 17 million last year. Including credit cards the bank has more than 32 million customer accounts in Asia.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
